title: [K-12] Online Chinese Learning Motivation Strategy Design: Self-Determination Theory-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Chinese communication skills and foundational understanding of pedagogical concepts
context.additional_context: A pre-service teacher program focusing on developing motivation strategies applicable to real-world settings

learning_goals: Design at least three strategies to apply the three elements of self-determination theory (autonomy, competence, relatedness) to an online Chinese learning environment

Within four weeks, learners can design two gamified motivational activities (mission-based quizzes, team competition tasks) incorporating gamification elements (experience points, leaderboards) for software development training targeting top 10 learners at vocational institutions, achieving ≥80% satisfaction in peer evaluations (average ≥4 on a 5-point scale) and instructor feedback (≥4 out of 5 criteria met).

In a blended environment (online collaboration tools + face-to-face workshops), learners can propose ≥3 social interaction facilitation strategies (e.g., feedback routines, role-division guidelines) using peer feedback systems (Padlet, Google Docs comments), and create an implementation plan meeting ≥4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.

Over a four-week intermediate course, learners can compile a personal motivation maintenance portfolio (3 projects) through project-based assessments (2 sessions) and deliver a 5-minute presentation achieving ≥4 out of 5 rubric items (≥80% fulfillment).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
